channel.title: Denver Homeless Out Loud
channel.description: Posts from Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: This fall a master lease for the City to be able to rent vacant...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

This fall a master lease for the City to be able to rent vacant apartments was presented to City Council by one of the council members. That way people wouldn't have to freeze on the streets. It failed 12-1. Where is the news coverage about how we are now facing the consequences of failing to come up with a solution that would keep people from freezing to death outside in the first place.
It is not like the occasional cold snap is a surprise. That does not make it any less dangerous for those stuck in it. Then our hero's would be people who made a plan to keep this from happening in the first place. We had a chance to prevent this from happening and chose not to invest in prevention. Now people are going to die from exposure.
https://kdvr.com/…/options-help-for-the-homeless-during-d…/…

Options, help for the homeless during dangerously cold weather

kdvr.com

Denver community works to help homeless during cold snap

Options, help for the homeless during dangerously cold weatherOptions, help for the homeless during dangerously cold weather

item.title: A collaboration of Denver organizations unite in one message to...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud was live.

A collaboration of Denver organizations unite in one message to the mayor: stop the traumatic displacements of our houseless neighbors. Members of the media will be joining us for an update on "The People's Audit," a research project to uncover the cost of the "sweeps."
Agenda:
A "welcome" from Jeff Campbell, From Allies to Abolitionists
Andy McNulty, Killmer Land & Newman: Update on the Denver Homeless Out Loud Federal Lawsuit
Denver Homeless Out Loud - Update on "Sweeps" wi...th firsthand perspective
Erika Righter, Denver Office of Strategic Partnerships Commission
Katy Owens, Colorado Coalition for the Homeless
John Staughton, From Allies to Abolitionists Research Team: People's Audit highlights and updates
Councilwoman Candi CdeBaca, District 9
Q+A from Press

See More3.2K Views
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: Yesterday the City SWEPT approximately 80-100 unhoused residents...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Yesterday the City SWEPT approximately 80-100 unhoused residents from 22nd and Stout St in 15 degree weather while snowing! Several residents had all of their belongings destroyed by the city in this brutal cold leaving them with nothing but the clothes on their back to survive the elements. We counted 16 DPD officers, 6 EHS staff, 4 social workers, 2 DOTI staff, 1 DOTI supervisor, and 18 mutual aid volunteers! The SWEEP began at 6 am and finished at 2pm.
The following day, T...he city crew was back at 22nd and Champa to SWEEP approximately 12-15 unhoused residents again in some of the coldest weather we've had all year! We counted 11 DPD officers, 4 EHS staff, 3 social workers, 3 DOTI staff, 1 DOTI supervisor, and 10 mutual aid volunteers! The SWEEP began at 6 am and finished at 11am.
This is the 10th time these exact same areas have been swept in the last year. PROVING that SWEEPING PEOPLE DOESN'T WORK! OUR tax dollars are better spent on HOUSING!! Until then, our city needs to work on providing trash and sanitation services to ALL residents. The game of whack-a-mole with humans needs to end. We continue to demand Housing, Rights, Dignity...

See More

item.title: This area was posted for a sweep on Thursday, February 11th, but...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

This area was posted for a sweep on Thursday, February 11th, but the city decided to sweep it a day early - violating the ruling of the recent injunction.

item.title: After some warm days last week we are approaching another week...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

After some warm days last week we are approaching another week of frigid temperatures. This is when the city has decided to resume sweeping unhoused community members to where? to nowhere....
This will be the 10th time this same encampment is swept in the last year. Proving that sweeping people DOES NOT WORK! DOTI has planned a SWEEP for February 10 and 11, 2021 in the area of Stout Street from 22nd to Park Avenue, 22nd from Champa to California and Park Avenue. The SWEEP ...will begin on both days at 6:30 a.m.
Please come and support our unhoused community members at 21st, 22nd, Stout and Park as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.
Bring the following things to assist residents:
-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water
Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.
Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing…

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: Big win in the courts.... 12 years of littigation. ----- ...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Big win in the courts.... 12 years of littigation.
-----
“Today’s settlement in the landmark Martin v. Boise case is a win for all residents of Boise, housed and unhoused alike, and serves as a national model for how other communities should be implementing the decision,” said Eric Tars, Legal Director at the National Homelessness Law Center. “By getting homeless individuals off the streets and into housing or shelter, there will be no need to enforce any ordinances agains...t them—housing, not handcuffs, is what ends homelessness.”

https://nlchp.org/settlement-martin-v-boise-case/

https://nlchp.org/settlement-martin-v-boise-case/

See MoreSettlement Reached in Groundbreaking Martin v. Boise case FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE Contact: Karianna Barr Director of Development & Communications 202-638-2535 kbarr@nlchp.org Parties reach historic agreement that prevents people experiencing homelessness from being cited or arrested for sleeping outdo...

item.title: Denver Homeless Out LoudColorado Village CollaborativeOur proposed contract to operate two Safe Outdoor Spaces unanimously passed through...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out LoudColorado Village Collaborative

Our proposed contract to operate two Safe Outdoor Spaces unanimously passed through City Council's Safety Committee this morning! As Robin Kniech, Denver City C...ouncil At-Large noted, these dollars are the result of community and council led advocacy effectively shaping public policy.

These two Safe Outdoor Spaces are only the beginning of what we can do, together.

item.title: "Austin City Council voted Thursday to use funds slashed...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"Austin City Council voted Thursday to use funds slashed from the police budget to purchase a hotel that will provide permanent supportive housing for people experiencing homelessness ...

The hotel is the fourth the Texas city has purchased"
-----------------------
Looks like hey are trying to get people off the street instead of blaming the victims of economic downturns for a poor economy.

...

Denver had a chance to move in this direction when a master lease program was proposed to city council. It was turned down 12-1.

https://truthout.org/…/austin-leads-the-way-in-cutting-pol…/

See MoreThe moves come as new Travis County DA José Garza rolls out bail reform and diversion policies.

truthout.org

Austin Leads the Way in Cutting Police Funding and Using the Money for Housing
